dataFlows.transformKql:
source | extend AssetID = case(
 not(isempty(tostring(azureId))), tostring(azureId),
 not(isempty(tostring(arn))), tostring(arn),
 not(isempty(tostring(driveId))), tostring(driveId),
 not(isempty(tostring(siteId))), tostring(siteId),
 not(isempty(tostring(rdsEndpoint))), tostring(rdsEndpoint),
 tostring(uid)
)
| extend ownersArr = iif(isnull(datastoreOwners), parse_json('[]'), todynamic(datastoreOwners))
| extend firstOwner = iif(array_length(ownersArr) > 0, ownersArr[0], parse_json('null'))
| extend owner_email = tostring(firstOwner.email),
 owner_upn = tostring(firstOwner.userPrincipalName),
 owner_name = tostring(firstOwner.name),
 owner_uid = tostring(firstOwner.datastoreOwnerUid)
| extend AssetOwner = case(
 isnotempty(owner_email), owner_email,
 isnotempty(owner_upn), owner_upn,
 isnotempty(owner_name), owner_name,
 isnotempty(owner_uid), owner_uid,
 isnotempty(tostring(account.name)), tostring(account.name),
 ''
)
| extend
 AssetName = tostring(name),
 Workload = tostring(['type']),
 SubWorkload = tostring(engine),
 Location = tostring(regions[0]),
 Risks = iif(isnull(issues.open), toint(0), toint(issues.open)),
 SensitivityLabel = tostring(sensitivity),
 Provider = 'Cyera',
 TimeGenerated = case(isempty(tostring(discoveredDate)), todatetime(createdDate), todatetime(discoveredDate))
| extend AdditionalFields = bag_pack(
 'AccountIdentifier', tostring(account.inPlatformIdentifier),
 'PublicAccessibilityState', tostring(publicAccessibilityState),
 'CloudPlatform', tostring(provider),
 'Regions', regions,
 'CloudProviderUrl', tostring(cloudProviderUrl),
 'ClassificationGroups', classificationGroups,
 'RecordCountBySensitivity', recordCountBySensitivity,
 'CloudProviderTags', cloudProviderTags,
 'UserTags', userTags,
 'OwnersRaw', ownersArr
)
| project AssetID, AssetName, Workload, SubWorkload, Location,
 Risks, SensitivityLabel, AssetOwner, TimeGenerated, Provider, AdditionalFields

source
| extend accountIdentifier = tostring(account.inPlatformIdentifier)
| extend assetName = tostring(name)
| extend assetType = tostring(['type'])
| extend engine = tostring(engine)
| extend location = tostring(regions[0])
| extend nativeAssetId = tostring(uid)
| extend openIssues = toint(issues.open)
| extend issuesClosed = toint(issues.closed)
| extend issuesInProgress = toint(issues.inProgress)
| extend assetOwner = tostring(datastoreOwners[0].email)
| extend publicAccessibilityState = tostring(publicAccessibilityState)
| extend regions = tostring(regions)
| extend sensitivity = tostring(sensitivity)
| extend sensitivityDisplayName = tostring(sensitivityDisplayName)
| extend classificationLevel = tostring(classificationLevel)
| extend uid = tostring(uid)
| extend workload = tostring(dataType)
| extend createdDate = todatetime(createdDate)
| extend lastModifiedDate = todatetime(lastModifiedTime)
| extend lastScannedDate = todatetime(discoveredDate)
| extend ghost = tobool(ghost)
| extend encrypted = tobool(encrypted)
| extend sslEnforced = tobool(sslEnforced)
| extend autoScan = tobool(autoScan)
| extend scanningState = tostring(scanningState)
| extend datastoreSizeInGiB = todouble(datastoreSizeInGiB)
| extend rcVerySensitive = toint(todynamic(recordCountBySensitivity)['VerySensitive'])
| extend rcSensitive = toint(todynamic(recordCountBySensitivity)['Sensitive'])
| extend rcInternal = toint(todynamic(recordCountBySensitivity)['Internal'])
| extend rcNotSensitive = toint(todynamic(recordCountBySensitivity)['NotSensitive'])
| extend rcUnclassified = toint(todynamic(recordCountBySensitivity)['Unclassified'])
| extend provider = tostring(provider)
| extend cloudProviderUrl = tostring(cloudProviderUrl)
| extend classificationGroups = classificationGroups
| extend cloudProviderTags = cloudProviderTags
| extend userTags = userTags
| extend AdditionalFields = bag_pack('OwnersRaw', datastoreOwners)
| extend TimeGenerated = todatetime(discoveredDate)
| project accountIdentifier, assetName, assetType, engine, location, nativeAssetId, openIssues, issuesClosed, issuesInProgress, assetOwner, publicAccessibilityState, regions, sensitivity, sensitivityDisplayName, classificationLevel, uid, workload, createdDate, lastModifiedDate, lastScannedDate, ghost, encrypted, sslEnforced, autoScan, scanningState, datastoreSizeInGiB, rcVerySensitive, rcSensitive, rcInternal, rcNotSensitive, rcUnclassified, provider, cloudProviderUrl, classificationGroups, cloudProviderTags, userTags, AdditionalFields, TimeGenerated

connectorUiConfig.title: Cyera DSPM Azure Functions Sentinel Data Connector
connectorUiConfig.descriptionMarkdown:
The **Cyera DSPM Azure Function Connector** enables seamless ingestion of Cyera’s **Data Security Posture Management (DSPM)** telemetry — *Assets*, *Identities*, *Issues*, and *Classifications* — into **Microsoft Sentinel**.

This connector uses an **Azure Function App** to call Cyera’s REST API on a schedule, fetch the latest DSPM telemetry, and send it to Sentinel through the **Azure Monitor Logs Ingestion API** via a **Data Collection Endpoint (DCE)** and **Data Collection Rule (DCR, kind: Direct)** — no agents required.

**Tables created/used**

| Entity | Table | Purpose |
|---|---|---|
| Assets | `CyeraAssets_v5_CL` | Raw asset metadata and data-store context |
| Identities | `CyeraIdentities_v5_CL` | Identity definitions and sensitivity context |
| Issues | `CyeraIssues_v5_CL` | Findings and remediation details |
| Classifications | `CyeraClassifications_v5_CL` | Data class & sensitivity definitions |
| MS View | `CyeraAssets_MS_v5_CL` | Normalized asset view for dashboards |

> **Note:** This v7 connector supersedes the earlier CCF-based approach and aligns with Microsoft’s recommended Direct ingestion path for Sentinel.
connectorUiConfig.additionalRequirementBanner: This connector deploys KQL transforms in the DCR. No parser function is required.

instructionSteps.title: Note
instructionSteps.description: >**NOTE:** This connector uses an **Azure Function App** and the **Azure Monitor Logs Ingestion API** (DCE + DCR, kind: Direct). Function runtime and data egress may incur charges. See [Azure Functions pricing](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/functions/).

instructionSteps.title: Optional Step
instructionSteps.description: >**(Optional)** Store Cyera API credentials in **Azure Key Vault** and reference them from the Function App. See [Key Vault references](https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/app-service/app-service-key-vault-references).

instructionSteps.title: STEP 1 — Prepare Cyera API Access
instructionSteps.description: 1) Generate a **Personal Access Token** [Generating Personal Access Token](https://support.cyera.io/hc/en-us/articles/19446274608919-Personal-and-API-Tokens) in your Cyera tenant.\n2) Note **API Base URL**, **Client ID**, and **Client Secret**.

instructionSteps.title: STEP 2 — Choose ONE deployment option
instructionSteps.description: > Before deploying, have these values handy:

parameters.label: Cyera Personal Access Token Client ID

instructionSteps.title: Option 1
instructionSteps.description:
[concat('**Option 1 - Azure Resource Manager (ARM) Template**

Use this method for automated deployment of the Cyera DSPM Functions and all required resources to support the connector.

1. Click the **Deploy to Azure** button below. 

	[![Deploy to Azure](https://aka.ms/deploytoazurebutton)](', variables('_armTemplateAzureFunctionsUri'), ')
2. Select the preferred **FunctionName** and **Workspace Name**. 
3. Enter the **Workspace Location**, **Cyera API Base Url**, **Personal Access Token Client ID**, and **Personal Access Token Secret**. 
>Note: If using Azure Key Vault secrets for any of the values above, use the`@Microsoft.KeyVault(SecretUri={Security Identifier})`schema in place of the string values. Refer to [Key Vault references documentation](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/app-service/app-service-key-vault-references) for further details. 
4. Mark the checkbox labeled **I agree to the terms and conditions stated above**. 
5. Click **Purchase** to deploy.')]

instructionSteps.title: Option 2 — Manual Deployment
instructionSteps.description:
[concat('Follow the [install pack’s step-by-step guide](', variables('_armTemplateAzureFunctionsInstallGuide'), '.

1) Create/update the 5 custom tables, data collection rule with format `sentinel-dce-<functuion_name>`, and data collection endpoint with format `sentinel-dcr-<functuion_name>` using the scripts in [install-pack-v0_7_0/scripts](', variables('_armTemplateAzureFunctionsScripts'), ').
2) Deploy the Azure Function from the repo`s Function folder (Timer-trigger; schedule typically 5–15 minutes).
3) Configure Function App settings:
   - `CyeraBaseUrl` — Cyera API Base URL
   - `CyeraClientId` — Client ID (PAT)
   - `CyeraSecret` — Client Secret (PAT)
   - `DCR_IMMUTABLE_ID` — DCR immutable ID
   - `DCE_ENDPOINT` — Logs ingestion endpoint URL
   - `STREAM_ASSETS`=`Custom-CyeraAssets`, `STREAM_IDENTITIES`=`Custom-CyeraIdentities`, `STREAM_ISSUES`=`Custom-CyeraIssues`, `STREAM_CLASSIFICATIONS`=`Custom-CyeraClassifications`
4) Save and Start the Function App.')]
